subject.name: Microprocessor
subject.description: This course introduces the fundamentals of microprocessor and microcontroller architecture, assembly language programming, interfacing, and applications in embedded systems.
objectives: To understand the architecture of 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microprocessors and microcontrollers
To learn assembly language programming for microprocessors and microcontrollers
To study interfacing of various peripherals such as I/O, ADC, DAC, timer, and sensors
To develop applications using different microcontrollers

units.title: Fundamentals of Microprocessors
topics: Fundamentals of Microprocessor Architecture
8-bit Microprocessor and Microcontroller architecture
Comparison of 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers
Definition and characteristics of embedded systems
Role of microcontroller in embedded systems
Overview of the 8051 family

units.title: The 8051 Architecture
topics: Internal block diagram: CPU, ALU, address, data and control bus
Working registers and SFRs
Clock and RESET circuits
Stack and Stack Pointer, Program Counter
I/O ports, Memory structures, Data and Program memory
Timing diagrams and Execution cycles

units.title: Instruction Set and Programming
topics: Addressing modes: immediate, register, direct, indirect, relative, indexed, bit addressing
8051 instruction set and instruction timings
Data transfer, arithmetic, and logical instructions
Branch, subroutine, and bit manipulation instructions
Assembly language programs and C language programs
Assemblers, compilers, programming and debugging tools

units.title: Memory and I/O Interfacing
topics: Memory and I/O expansion buses
Control signals and memory wait states
Interfacing of peripheral devices such as general purpose I/O, ADC, DAC, timers, and memory devices

units.title: External Communication Interface
topics: Synchronous and asynchronous communication
RS232, SPI, I2C protocols
Introduction and interfacing to Bluetooth and ZigBee

units.title: Applications
topics: LED, LCD, and keyboard interfacing
Stepper motor and DC motor interfacing
Sensor interfacing

suggested_books: M.A. Mazidi, J.G. Mazidi, and R.D. McKinlay, The 8051 Microcontroller and Embedded Systems: Using Assembly and C, Pearson Education, 2007
K.J. Ayala, 8051 Microcontroller, Delmar Cengage Learning, 2004
R. Kamal, Embedded System, McGraw Hill Education, 2009
R.S. Gaonkar, Microprocessor Architecture: Programming and Applications with the 8085, Penram International Publishing, 1996
D.A. Patterson and J.H. Hennessy, Computer Organization and Design: The Hardware/Software Interface, McGraw Hill Higher Education, 1991
